subject: Psychology
title: Emerging Adulthood
description: A quick win: understand Emerging Adulthood.

hook.text: She's 24, has a degree, three roommates, and no idea what she wants. Is she an adult? She's not sure herself.

buildup.text: Jeffrey Arnett proposed emerging adulthood â€” a stage between 18 and 25 marked by identity exploration and instability.

discovery.text: This stage feels in-between: no longer adolescent, not yet fully adult. Identity, work, and love are all in flux.

twist.text: Critics note this stage applies mainly to privileged, Western youth. Many young people globally must adult much earlier.

climax.text: Emerging adulthood reflects how modern economies delay traditional milestones â€” career, marriage, parenthood.

punchline.text: Adulthood isn't a switch. For many, it's a slow fade-in.

quiz.question: What age range does emerging adulthood cover?
